title: Exhaust Silencer - Removal - with Single Seat

body.body: Exhaust Silencer - Removal - with Single Seat
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.

If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components may be hot to the touch. Contact with the hot components may cause damage to exposed skin. To avoid skin damage, always allow the hot parts to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Always note the position and orientation of the exhaust clamps prior to releasing them, and return them to the noted position and orientation on assembly.
Release the clamps securing the silencers to the intermediate pipe.
Note the position of the washers and rubber bushes in the footrest hanger for installation.
Note the position of the washers and rubber bushes in the silencer mounting for installation.
Support the silencer, remove the rear mounting fixing and remove the silencer. Discard the lock nut.
Remove and discard the exhaust gasket.
